headline: Shipping Is the New COGS: Carriers' 2026 Rate Hikes Are Squeezing Ecommerce Margins
summary: As UPS, FedEx, and other major carriers roll out their 2026 rate structures, the ecommerce landscape faces a critical inflection point. With headline General Rate Increases (GRIs) of 5.9% masking effective increases of 10–20% due to surcharges, shipping has ceased to be a simple operational expense. It has evolved into a core component of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), determining whether online retailers are profitable or merely busy. Ship.com, a leading shipping platform for high-growth brands, to

content.title: Shipping Is the New COGS: Carriers' 2026 Rate Hikes Are Squeezing Ecommerce Margins
content.summary: As UPS, FedEx, and other major carriers roll out their 2026 rate structures, the ecommerce landscape faces a critical inflection point. With headline General Rate Increases (GRIs) of 5.9% masking effective increases of 10–20% due to surcharges, shipping has ceased to be a simple operational expense. It has evolved into a core component of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), determining whether online retailers are profitable or merely busy. thumbnail.caption: "We are here to tell founders that if they don't treat shipping like COGS, they aren't running a business; they are subsidizing a carrier.”
